Ukraine faces US ultimatum to accept a lopsided 'peace plan'
subhead: Donald Trump has given Kyiv until November 27 to agree to a proposed deal that heavily favors Russia. European leaders, confronted with a fait accompli, are striving to support Volodymyr Zelensky and put forward counterproposals.
byline: By Claire Gatinois (Johannesburg (South Africa), special correspondent) and Piotr Smolar (Washington (United States) correspondent)

title: As elections approach, French politicians are increasingly addicted to polls
Sex, lies and bicycles: Espionage scandal rocks Denmark
A stroll through Cachan: From a royal aqueduct to a panoramic garden
subhead: The town of Val-de-Marne, traversed by a monumental aqueduct since the 17th century, offers a rewarding detour from the RER commuter train, with a beautiful Art Deco belfry crowning its city hall, an artists' hamlet, gourmet arcades, organic vineyards and green spaces to explore by bike.

title: The fall of Northvolt, Sweden's symbol of green reindustrialization
subhead: On March 12, the electric battery giant shut its doors for good. Nearly 5,000 people employed at the Skelleftea gigafactory lost their jobs. As the US-based company Lyten prepares to restart production, Northvolt's downfall has cast a chill over Sweden's ambitions to reindustrialize around clean technology.

title: Supreme Court pauses block on new Texas voting districts
subhead: The rush to redistrict and draw up new safe seats reflects an intense battle playing out across the country. Democratic-run California has already approved drawing up a new electoral map that would also create five districts more likely to vote for the party.

title: Trump's odd day: Enthralled by Socialist Zohran Mamdani and abandoned by MAGA lawmaker Marjorie Taylor Greene
subhead: The US president lavished praise on New York City's mayor-elect during a White House visit on Friday. Almost simultaneously, one of his most fervent allies announced her resignation from the House of Representatives, formalizing her break with the Republican leader.
byline: By Nicolas Chapuis (New York (United States) correspondent)

title: Azzedine Alaïa's Dior collection on view in Paris
'He looked me up and down': Hostesses, flight attendants and waitresses speak out about everyday sexualization
subhead: Crude jokes, inappropriate stares and overt flirting are commonplace for women in service jobs where physical appearance is paramount. Employees remain poorly protected from this sexualization, which can amount to harassment.

title: Fluctuating pay, seasonal work: Welcome to China's 'iPhone City'
subhead: Foxconn's production lines, driven by Apple's marketing strategy, need workers only for part of the year. Still, many are drawn to the overtime pay and bonuses.

title: Nicolas Guillou, French ICC judge sanctioned by the US: 'You are effectively blacklisted by much of the world's banking system'
subhead: Six judges and three prosecutors at the International Criminal Court have been sanctioned by the Trump administration. In an interview with Le Monde, Guillou discusses the impact of these measures on his work and daily life.
byline: Interview by Stéphanie Maupas (The Hague (Netherlands) correspondent)
